turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Pedal steel guitar.
turn.1: How did the Pedal steel guitar come about?
turn.2: Beauchamp enrolled in electronics courses and, for his first effort, he made a single-string guitar out of a 2x4 piece of lumber and experimented with phonograph pickups, but had no success.
turn.4: He eventually came up with the idea of using two horseshoe magnets encircling the guitar strings like a bracelet, and six small metal rods wrapped with wire to concentrate the magnetic field (one under each guitar string).
turn.6: When connected to an electronic amplifier and loudspeaker, it worked.
turn.7: What did he do after that?
turn.8: He enlisted the aid of a skilled craftsman to fashion a guitar neck and body to connect to his device.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: The final construct, he thought, resembled a frying pan, and that is what the instrument was nicknamed.
turn.12: He applied for patent June 2, 1934 and received it on August 10, 1937.
